interface.name: zcr_ui_controls_v1
interface.description:
This global provides requests for different type of input emulation that mirror the semantics of Chrome's ui_controls functions.
Additionally, there is a set_toplevel_bounds request to help with the implementation of automated UI testing in compositors that don't support aura_shell (i.e. Weston).

enum.name: key_state

description.summary: whether to press, release, or press and release a key

enum.description: These flags signal which key events to emulate: press; release; or press, then release.

enum.name: mouse_button
enum.description: Which mouse button to emulate an event for.

enum.name: mouse_button_state

description.summary: whether to press, release, or click a mouse button

enum.description: These flags signal which mouse button events to emulate: press; release; or press, then release.

enum.name: modifier
enum.description: These flags signal which modifiers should be pressed during an emulated input, if any.

enum.name: touch_type

description.summary: type of touch to be generated

enum.description: These flags signal whether to emulate a touch press, release, or move.

request.name: send_key_events

description.summary: emulate a key press/release/press and release

request.description: Requests the compositor to emulate a key press, release, or press and release for the key corresponding to the given keycode, together with the specified modifiers. The compositor will decide which specific events to generate in response to this request. After the compositor has finished processing this request, a request_processed event with a matching `id` will be emitted.

arg.name: key_state
arg.summary: whether to press, release, or press and release the key

arg.name: id
arg.summary: will be echoed back in the matching sent event

request.name: send_mouse_move

description.summary: emulate a mouse move to the given location

request.description:
Requests the compositor to emulate a mouse move to the given location. The compositor will decide which specific events to generate in response to this request. After the compositor has finished processing this request, a request_processed event with a matching `id` will be emitted.
If `surface` is null, `x` and `y` are global screen coordinates; else, they are surface-local coordinates relative to `surface`.

arg.name: surface
arg.summary: surface that x and y are relative to

arg.name: id
arg.summary: will be echoed back in the matching sent event

request.name: send_mouse_button
request.description: Requests the compositor to emulate an up (if `state` is up) / down (if `state` is down) / click (i.e. down and up, if `state` is down|up) for the specified mouse button at the current mouse position, together with the specified modifiers. The compositor will decide which specific events to generate in response to this request. After the compositor has finished processing this request, a request_processed event with a matching `id` will be emitted.

arg.name: button
arg.summary: button code of the mouse button

arg.name: button_state
arg.summary: whether to press, release, or click the button

arg.name: id
arg.summary: will be echoed back in the matching sent event

request.name: send_touch
request.description:
Requests the compositor to emulate a touch down (if `action` is press) / touch up (if `action` is release) / move (if `action` is move) / combination of these (if `action` is a combination of these flags) for the touch point with the specified `id` (see wl_touch.down) at the specified location. The compositor will decide which specific events to generate in response to this request. After the compositor has finished processing this request, a request_processed event with a matching `id` will be emitted.
If `surface` is null, `x` and `y` are global screen coordinates; else, they are surface-local coordinates relative to `surface`.

arg.name: action
arg.summary: whether to emaulate a press, release, tap, or move

arg.name: touch_id
arg.summary: unique ID of the touch point (see wl_touch.down)

arg.name: surface
arg.summary: surface that x and y are relative to

arg.name: id
arg.summary: will be echoed back in the matching sent event

request.name: set_toplevel_bounds

description.summary: resize and/or move a toplevel surface

request.description: Requests the compositor to apply the specified bounds to the given toplevel surface. This request may be ignored by the compositor for any reason.

event.name: request_processed
event.description: The request with ID `id` has been fully processed.
